result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rico R Velasquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
11:08 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow agreement has been reached, defendant will plea to counts 1 & 2 on 2016CF50, with no enhancers and 2016CM115 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 on 2016CF50, striking the repeater and place enhancers and orders 2016CM115 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by Bob Dore.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 2

-120 days county jail, with huber to commence immediately.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  Court grants the defendant 81 days of sentence credit.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:26 a.m.
Status hearing on August 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on June 21, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Jeanne Zamzow - requests the status hearing scheduled on 06/14 be rescheduled to 06/21 due to a conflict
Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.

2:16 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint on 2016CF50, but not on 2016CM115 and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  DA states bond has been.  Court reviews bonds there were set: $250 cash on 2016CF50 and $500 signature bond on 2016CM115.  Statement by Atty Privat regarding the cash bond.  Court leaves the cash bond in place.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 14, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  Court adjourns misdemeanor to later.

Court adjourned at 2:22 p.m.

2:25 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Privat enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court notes bond has been set - $500 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing w/felony case.

Court adjourned at 2:26 p.m.
Defendant in appears by video from Green Lake County Jail

1:01 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail, without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature on 16CM115.  Court sets $250.00 caseh bond on 16CF50.  Court sets initial apperance on May 16th at 2:45 p.m.
Court adjourned 1:04 p.m.
